body:
Comment 9 by **skinner.david**: 
I quite understand. I reported the problem to both package owners as well
and they identified and resolved the actual problem in this case. It is of
course difficult for you to write meaningful error messages for errors that
you have never seen and never anticipated. I suppose that I was hoping you
could improve the error message, perhaps some context seg fault while doing
something, just a clue that would point me to the right direction. No need
to bloat the code for a rare use case. If there is something simple and
easy that would make things better for the next person, that would be
great, otherwise, don't worry about it unless it proves to be more of a
problem in the future. I was in no position to judge what the nature of the
problem was so I just reported it to everyone.

Thanks for reviewing my case and thanks for helping to create such a
wonderful product, I really love Go.
